accessibility.title: Verify username field is accessible on mobile devices with proper touch target size
preconditions: User is accessing login page on mobile device (iOS or Android) or mobile emulator
Username input field is visible on mobile viewport
Touch input is available
Page is responsive and mobile-optimized

steps.action: Load login page on mobile device or in mobile emulator (viewport 375x667 or similar)
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads and displays correctly in mobile viewport

steps.action: Locate the username input field on the mobile screen
steps.expectedResult: Username field is visible, properly sized, and not cut off or overlapping

steps.action: Measure or verify the touch target size of the username field is at least 44x44 CSS pixels (iOS) or 48x48dp (Android)
steps.expectedResult: Username field touch target meets minimum size requirements: at least 44x44 pixels for easy tapping

steps.action: Tap on the username input field with finger
steps.expectedResult: Field receives focus immediately, mobile keyboard appears, cursor is visible in field

steps.action: Type username 'mobileuser' using mobile keyboard
steps.expectedResult: Text 'mobileuser' appears in field as typed, mobile keyboard functions properly

steps.action: Verify label 'Username' is visible and readable on mobile screen
steps.expectedResult: Label text is not too small, maintains readability on mobile device (at least 16px font size recommended)

steps.action: Tap outside the field to dismiss keyboard and verify entered text is retained
steps.expectedResult: Mobile keyboard dismisses, username 'mobileuser' remains in field, field loses focus

postconditions: Username field is easily tappable on mobile devices
Touch target size meets WCAG 2.1 Level AAA guidelines (2.5.5)
Mobile keyboard interaction works correctly
Field is fully functional on mobile devices for users with motor impairments

userStoryObject.title: As End User, I want to input my username to achieve identification for authentication
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
Users need to provide their username as the primary identifier during login to access the system securely.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, there is no interface allowing users to input their username, preventing authentication.

DESIRED STATE:
Users can enter their username easily and accurately through a dedicated input field.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
‚Ä¢ Display a clearly labeled username input field
‚Ä¢ Support placeholder text to guide input
‚Ä¢ Allow keyboard and screen reader accessibility
‚Ä¢ Validate non-empty input before submission

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. User navigates to the login page
2. User locates the username input field
3. User enters their username
4. System validates that the field is not empty
5. User proceeds to enter password
6. User submits the login form

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Data source: Frontend form input
‚Ä¢ Validation rules: Non-empty, no special characters
‚Ä¢ API endpoints: N/A for input
‚Ä¢ Security: Input sanitization to prevent injection
‚Ä¢ Performance: Instant client-side validation

OUT OF SCOPE:
‚Ä¢ Password input and validation
‚Ä¢ Backend authentication processing

SUCCESS METRICS:
‚Ä¢ 100% of login forms display username input
‚Ä¢ 95% reduction in empty username submissions
‚Ä¢ Accessibility compliance with WCAG 2.1 standards
acceptanceCriteria: System displays a username input field with label 'Username' and placeholder 'Enter your username'
System prevents form submission if the username field is empty and shows inline error 'Username is required'
System supports keyboard navigation and screen reader announcements for the username field
System sanitizes username input to prevent injection attacks
